events.name: I/O Extended 2017 Njikoka
events.description: Google I/O is an annual outdoor developer festival. I/O Extended 2017 Njikoka is an event that brings students, tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs and local developer communities together in Njikoka to experience the I/O keynotes and sessions with one another in real-time, discuss and network. We will also be offering codelabs and hackathons activities. The event would last for three (3) days where the first day would be for I/O keynotes, the second day for Codelabs sessions and intensive trainings for participants (mainly for Computer Science students and tech enthusiasts) who want to learn how to develop Android Mobile Apps and the third day for hackathons, competitions, and demos. We would be inviting tech professionals on the third day to become judges to the competitions and whoever wins would be given an Android Mobile device as a prize.

events.name: Android Tech Talk
events.description:
Android tech talk is a tech event designed specifically for newbies but we also welcome experienced developers to be part of the event. In this event newbies, especially those new to GDG Njikoka that attended our previous events but were unable to really follow-up at some points in the event, will have the opportunity to ask whatever questions they might have related to Android development as they'll all be answered. They’ll also have the opportunity to discuss the challenges they face while developing for Android and we’ll provide the best possible solutions to solve the problems.

We’ll be spending time in discussing the things involve in developing for Android from start to finish while we develop a simple Android app as this will give the newbie an understanding of what they need to know during Android development. As usual, we are going to do our very best to make it very simple to understand especially for newbies and new members to GDG Njikoka – You’ll enjoy it.

Like I said earlier, we welcome developers of all levels and encourage those with more experience to help out those that are just starting. There is always at least one mentor present to guide you through if you are stuck with a nasty problem!  :)

This event is free but hey no food/snacks will be provided. Please make sure to eat before attending the event. If you want to bring snacks for everyone, please don’t hesitate to let me know. :)

PLEASE DO NOT FORGET TO COME WITH YOUR LAPTOPS.

Thanks.

events.name: GDG DevFest SE 2017
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

We are excited to announce that Google Developer Group (GDG) Aba will be hosting Developers Festival (DevFest 2017) for South South and South East Nigeria on November 10, 2017 at Eldorado Event Center Aba. DevFest 2016 held in Port Harcourt, Rivers State and was a huge success. 500 developers, entrepreneurs, organisations and government representatives were present at the event which took place at the The Autograph Port Harcourt, Rivers State. Nigeria. DevFest 2016 set the bar rather high, but we are definite we will host a bigger and more successful event this time around. For DevFest 2017, rockstar speakers and Googlers from Google Nigeria will speak and facilitate sessions on the following technologies: 

Google technologies and how we can leverage them to solve local problems 
Android App Development
Firebase 
Assistant
Google App Engine 
Progressive Web Apps 
Polymer 
Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence 
UI/UX 
Hands-on Codelabs on Android app development 
Robotics and Drone Technologies  

You may also visit https://devefestse.tech to register and keep up to date on developments. This will be the biggest developer conference (Convergence) in South South/ South East Nigeria for 2017. 

Happy DevFest 2017!!!

events.name: Google Study Jam (Web): Mobile Sites Certification
events.description:
• What we'll do
So what is Mobile Web/Sites Certification Study Jams?
Google's Mobile Web/Sites Certification Study Jam is a professional accreditation that Google offers to individuals who demonstrate understanding in basic and advanced aspects of mobile website design and development. GDG Njikoka is happy to participate in this year’s Google's Mobile Web/Sites Certification Study Jam. There will be in-person sessions and then followed by multiple choice exam. Training participants will gain specific skill they can use for career advancement or personal development. Participants that complete the exam receive a printable certificate to verify status as certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification.

Why do you need great Mobile Web Skills?
Mobile now accounts for over half of all web traffic. Users expect their small-screen experiences to be as quick and intuitive as those on desktop. But making the mobile web fast and easy takes some special skills.
53% of mobile visitors will leave if the page takes more than three seconds to load. The average page takes 22 seconds to load, so collectively we're losing a lot of mobile users and giving them a bad experience along the way. Speed is only one part of the picture when creating great mobile experiences.

• What to bring

• Important to know
So what's the End Result?
Attendees that participated and complete the exam receive a printable certificate to verify status as a certified mobile sites professional and a Google Partners public profile page listing the certification.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jams
events.description:
• What we'll do
What's is Google Cloud Study Jams?
GDG Njikoka is over excited to participate in this year's Google's Cloud Study Jams. Google Cloud Study Jam gives you the opportunity to learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it, and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the lab which worth over $70 US dollars. Attendees need not create Google Cloud Platform account or register with their credit/debit/ATM card. This training gives GDG Njikoka community members a specific skills they can use for personal development or career advancement.
We will go through three labs in the Google Cloud Platform Essentials, after which you will receive free access to the next quest. You will gain practical experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will give you additional Google badges.

Why you should attend?
Community members will get one month free Qwiklabs
Community members will learn how to setup development and production environments in the cloud
Community members will learn how Docker and Kubernetes work, or learn how to process Big Data in the cloud
Community members to get access to Qwiklabs, a Google training tool, free of charge (a $70+ value)
Google-hosted badges that attendees can use in their online profiles and show to employers what they know about Cloud computing
Earning another badge = another month free access to Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Essential Labs
Celebration of participants who completed the Google Cloud Study Jam
Community members learn the skills necessary for building Google Cloud platform driven applications

• What to bring

• Important to know

events.name: TensorFlow Dev Summit 2018 GDG Njikoka
events.description:
TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning (ML) users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community. We're using this as an opportunity to also build local ML community as well as engaging with our local ML users.

• What's the end result?
Here's what you'll learn during the event:
- How to use a programming language and TensorFlow to train an image classifier
- How to classify images with your trained classifier
- How to (a) train a custom image recognition model, (b) how to optimize your model, and (c) how to compress your model
- How to run it in a pre-made Android app
- You'll learn to build a simple camera app that runs a TensorFlow image recognition program to identify flowers
- And more...

events.name: IWD Women Techmakers Njikoka 2018
events.description:
• What we'll do
International Women’s Day (IWD) is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. Google now celebrates IWD with special Women Techmakers (WTM) events. Women Techmakers is Google’s global program for women in the tech space. Women Techmakers provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology to drive innovation and participation in the field. GDG Njikoka's Women Techmakers event is designed to promote an environment of inclusion for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, students, entrepreneurs and technology enthusiasts.

• What's the end result?
Here's some of the things you will learn during the event:
- Introduction to Android Development and writing your first Android app
- Building Android Apps that Sign In with Google
- Getting Started with Android Pay
- And more...

• What to bring
Please come with a Laptop if you've any.

• Important to know
This event is NOT only meant for women. It's for both (wo)men/(fe)males.

events.name: Google Assistant: Build Actions for Your Community
events.description:
NOTE:
======
Don't forget that this event is part of the "Build Actions for Your Community" events series. So here's links to the next event of the series:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Njikoka/events/248616263/

• What we'll do
EVENT DESCRIPTION:
=====================
The "Build Actions for Your Community" is a Google-supported events around the world to let participants and developers learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community. It is an open and modular event series designed by Google and GDG Njikoka is offering opportunities to participants and developers attending our events to learn how to build Actions for the Google Assistant that are useful for their community. This allows attendees to be able to build something in an area that they care about or are interested in. The Actions on Google and Google Assistant are one of the major Google technical areas and Google is inviting the whole developer community to learn about creating Actions for the Google Assistant.
Why we're hosting events in the series?
- Attendees and members will learn a lot about the Assistant!
- Attendees and community members would be attracted to new and hot technologies and the series is aimed at all levels of developers - whether newbies, beginners, intermediate and experienced developers.
- The format of the events and activities brings members and attendees the best experience.
- The events series is being promoted globally which even makes it more "legit" and the quality of the format of the events and activities is something you would definitely can't afford to miss!
Hey wait, that's not all! Few of the core series elements that would happen in each event day include: Tech Talks, Codelabs & Hackathons, Technical Feedback Sessions, Actions showcasing on events and on dedicated Google website, Webinars for attendees, members and developers, Competition!!! (Prizes would be given to the winners), etc.

EVENT AGENDA:
================
TALK & CODELABS
--------------------------
TIME -------------------- TOPIC
10:30AM -------------- Registration
11:00AM -------------- Welcome
11:10AM --------------- Building Conversational Experiences with Actions on
--------------------------- Google (DESCRIPTION: Overview of Google Assistant
--------------------------- and Actions on Google)
11:40AM -------------- Conversational Design Intro (DESCRIPTION: Overview of
--------------------------- Conversational Design)
12:10PM --------------- [LAUNCH] Refreshment: Food and Drinks
01:00PM -------------- [CODELAB] Facts about you: Build a conversational App
--------------------------- (DESCRIPTION: Full codelab for participants to learn
--------------------------- how to build an Action including conversational design)
04:30PM -------------- [WRAP UP] Event resources sharing
04:45PM -------------- Photography
05:00PM -------------- Goodbye/Networking

• What to bring
Although, this is NOT mandatory but please come with a laptop if you have any.

• Important to know
NON-PROFIT:
=============
We are NOT charging for the events so attendees and members are NOT expected/will NOT be asked to make any form of payment for the events. The events are non-profit and it is 100% FREE OF CHARGE.

NOTE:
======
Don't forget that this event is part of the "Build Actions for Your Community" events series. So here's links to the next event of the series:
https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Njikoka/events/248616263/

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Njikoka
events.description:
Google I/O Extended is an annual outdoor developer festival focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. I/O Extended 2018 Njikoka brings students, tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs and local developer communities together to experience the Google I/O keynotes and sessions with one another in real-time, discuss, network and offer unique activities targeted to developers, such as hackathons and codelabs.

NOTE: The hackathon winner would be given a brand new Android smartphone.

*** DAY 1 AGENDA: ***
======================
- Arrival and registration of attendees
- Opening remarks
- 2018 Google I/O Keynote
- 2018 I/O Developer Keynote
- Refreshment, Networking & Hackathon planning
- Media streaming code excercise
- Android Auto Backup code excercise
- Finalize Hackathon participants
- Hackathon participants starts their hack projects
- Closure

Link to 2nd Event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Njikoka/events/250950352/

events.name: I/O Extended 2018 Njikoka
events.description:
Google I/O Extended is an annual outdoor developer festival focused on bringing the local developer community together to experience the keynote and other main Google I/O sessions, in real-time. I/O Extended 2018 Njikoka brings students, tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs and local developer communities together to experience the Google I/O keynotes and sessions with one another in real-time, discuss, network and offer unique activities targeted to developers, such as hackathons and codelabs.

NOTE: The hackathon winner would be given a brand new Android smartphone.

***DAY 2 AGENDA:***
=====================
- Arrival and registration of attendees
- Flutter talk
- Customize Material Components for your product
- Build great Material Design products across platforms
- Code beautiful UI with Flutter and Material Design
- Total mobile development made fun with Flutter and Firebase
- Build reactive mobile apps with Flutter
- Add Firebase to your cross-platform React Native or Flutter app
- Refreshment and Networking
- Write Your First Flutter App, Part 1 code exercise
- Write Your First Flutter App, Part 2 code exercise
- Building Beautiful UIs with Flutter code exercise
- Hackathon Continues
- Closure

Link to 1st Event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Njikoka/events/250950297/
Link to 3rd Event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Njikoka/events/250950439/

I/O Extended 2018 Njikoka brings students, tech enthusiasts, entrepreneurs and local developer communities together to experience the Google I/O keynotes and sessions with one another in real-time, discuss, network and offer unique activities targeted to developers, such as hackathons and codelabs. events.name: Invitation-Only DevFest 2018 Prep
events.description: This is an invitation-only meet-up focused on preparation for the upcoming DevFest 2018 event.

events.name: DevFest South-East Nigeria - 2018
events.description:
GDG DevFest South-East Nigeria is a large, annual all-day community-run developer conference offering speaker sessions across multiple Google's product areas, codelabs, hackathon, design sprints, and even more!

Actions on Google
Android
Artificial Intelligence
Cloud
Firebase
Flutter
Machine Learning
PWA

Attendees would gain insight into Google's latest tools and innovations. They'll also have the opportunity to network with tech experts during the event.

events.name: GDG Njikoka Meetup
events.description: This is our first meetup for the year to discuss and get ready for upcoming events as well as get our minds up-to-speed with trending, recommended and the most used technologies.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam 2019
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home.
Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.
If you've a laptop and charger, please bring them. There'll be electricity and free internet access. There's refreshment too!

events.name: IWD Njikoka 2019
events.description:
• What we'll do:
International Women’s Day (IWD) is a day to celebrate the achievements of women while calling for greater equality within our communities. Google now celebrates IWD with special Women Techmakers (WTM) events. Women Techmakers is Google’s global program for women in the tech space. Women Techmakers provides visibility, community, and resources for women in technology to drive innovation and participation in the field. GDG Njikoka's Women Techmakers event is designed to promote an environment of inclusion for women in technology, as well as celebrate women leading the industry. We want to advance, grow, and celebrate women developers, designers, students, entrepreneurs and technology enthusiasts.

• What's the end result?:
Here's some of the things you will learn during the event:
- Building Google Maps using Web Components and No Code!
- Introduction to Java and writing your first Java program
- Introduction to Android Development and writing your first Android app
- Building Android Apps that Sign In with Google
- Getting Started with Android Pay
- Building a speedy mobile checkout
- And more...

• What you may bring:
If you've a laptop and charger, please bring them. If you don't have, please come!

• What we'll provide:
There'll be electricity and free internet access for your devices. There's refreshment too!

• Important to know:
This event is NOT only meant for women. It's for both males and females.

events.name: Next '19 Extended Njikoka
events.description:
GDG Njikoka is excited to participate in this year's Google Cloud Next Extended 2019. Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ’19 experience. These events are extensions of Next - allowing local developers to access exciting Next ’19 content and engage with peers across the community through hands-on labs and speaker events.

Agenda:
- Livestreams and/or recordings of relevant keynotes and sessions.
- Next '19 Extended Study Jams.
- Cloud Study Jam.

events.name: Global Documentation Sprint for TensorFlow 2.0
events.description:
TensorFlow 2.0 is a major release focused on ease of use and clarity while maintains its flexibility. TensorFlow docs sprint is a way to improve the documentation for the TensorFlow 2.0 open-source library.

Are you interesting in learning about what's new with TensorFlow (TF) 2.0? Do you get a little tingle of excitement whenever you see or create an excellent piece of technical writing? Do you love to communicate complex topics in an understandable straightforward way? Would you like to contribute to one of the most popular open-source machine learning frameworks and learn the PR and review process? Look no further! You can get started by improving the TF 2.0 documentation.
Documentation is a developer's first impression of any open-source project, and one of the most important pieces of any software application.
One of the primary focus areas of TensorFlow 2.0 is documentation, and the team are firmly committed to improving it for the latest iteration of the API.

Come join the global docs sprint at GDG Njikoka, where you'll learn how to document an API symbol, create report issues on GitHub, review and create your first pull request to the TensorFlow repo for making changes to TensorFlow documentation.

events.name: I/O Extended Njikoka 2019
events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

This year's I/O event at GDG Njikoka will be an event for local developers, students and tech enthusiasts to experience the Google I/O keynotes and sessions with one another, learn (hands-on), discuss, network and offer unique activities such as hackathons and codelabs.

events.name: Kotlin/Everywhere Njikoka
events.description:
Learn the essentials and best practices of using Kotlin everywhere: on Android, Google Cloud Platform and multi-platform.

Kotlin is a modern and statically typed programming language targeting the JVM, Android, JavaScript & Native that will boost your productivity and increase your developer happiness.

Want to get started with Kotlin, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Kotlin/Everywhere event.
You will get hands-on experience with Kotlin in Android, multi-platform with Kotlin/Native, Google Cloud Platform and Kotlin/JS.

EXTRAS: Refreshments, internet access and electricity.

events.name: Google Cloud Study Jam 2019
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home.
Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.
If you've a laptop and charger, please bring them. There'll be electricity and free internet access. There's refreshment too!
